definition: quarter (hour)/moment/to carve/to engrave/to cut/oppressive/classifier for short time intervals
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
to make a conscious effort/to do something deliberately

sentences.english: Study that list, and deliberately plan on at least one joy each day.
sentences.chinese: 研究這個列表，每天刻意地安排至少一件開心的事。

sentences.english: He had in fact intentionally used crystal methylene.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，他曾刻意服用晶體甲基。

sentences.english: As so often, apparently, the fox shrine was a hidden-away part of a larger and more public temple-complex.
sentences.chinese: 很顯然，公衆熟悉的大的寺廟常常刻意隱藏狐仙廟。

sentences.english: Compliments heard second-hand have more credibility within the intended recipient.
sentences.chinese: 二手讚美比刻意在人前奉承更能取信於人。

sentences.english: Unlike the tower in Pisa, the Capital Gate building has been deliberately engineered to slant.
sentences.chinese: 和比薩斜塔不同，這座塔的傾斜是刻意建造而成。
街道的陡度並非刻意爲之。

sentences.english: And in public appearances he does not even try to disguise his erudition.
sentences.chinese: 在公開露面的場合，他也不刻意隱瞞他的博學多聞。

sentences.english: Misunderstanding (MIS) and deliberate misinterpretation (DMI) are two notions that are easy to be mixed up.
sentences.chinese: 誤解和刻意曲解是兩個易被混淆的概念。

sentences.english: It is typical of BarCap, he says, to try to be unfashionable.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，刻意不趕時髦是巴克萊資本的典型風格。

sentences.english: Keep your posture erect but not overly posed. Think “Greek Statue,” not “William Shatner.”
sentences.chinese: 保持垂直姿勢，但不要過於刻意。

sentences.english: God intentionally allows you to go through painful experiences to equip you for ministry to others.
sentences.chinese: 神刻意容許你經歷這些痛苦，爲要裝備你去服事別人。

sentences.english: In order not to violate the mother lives, Liu Naou deliberately wronged themselves, something the mother can be described as Shiko.
sentences.chinese: 爲了不違母命，劉吶鷗刻意委屈自己，事母可謂至孝。

sentences.english: The next day, shu mei in order to retrieve the phone, deliberately take open car back to the company.
sentences.chinese: 翌日，淑梅爲了取回手機，刻意乘坐開朗的車回公司。

sentences.english: Do not use to give oneself more recollections sedulously so-called.
sentences.chinese: 不要用所謂的刻意來給自己更多的回憶。

sentences.english: Then, deliberately, he pours maple syrup into his oatmeal.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他又刻意往燕麥片粥裏倒進楓糖漿。

sentences.english: Stop obfuscating the information and embellishing it.
sentences.chinese: 不要再刻意潤飾各種一塌糊塗的信息了。

definition: to make a conscious effort/to do something deliberately
to get the desired outcome/to win favor by fawning on sb/to curry favor with/a fruitful outcome to reward one's labor
to make a supreme effort/at all costs
need not/does not have to/not necessarily
to cover up/to conceal/to mask/to gloss over
inadvertent/accidental/to have no intention of (doing sth)
